sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"发现"之意。
means: discover ： 普通用词，指发现本来存在，但示被认识的事物、真理或情况。
find ： 普通用词，可指偶然发现，也可指经过寻找后得到或重新获得已失去的东西。强调动作的结果。
detect ： 正式用词，强调经过周密观察或研究而有所获得和发现，尤指发现有意隐藏之物。
ascertain ： 较正式用词，指有意搜寻与发现。

sentence.Network_en: I will return, find you, love you, marry you and live without shame.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会回去，找到你，爱你，娶你，活的光明正大。《赎罪》

sentence.Network_en: I have $100m hidden away where no one will ever find it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我把1亿美元藏到了一个永远没人会找到的地方。

sentence.Network_en: It would be difficult to find two men who were more dissimilar.
sentence.Network_cn: 很难找到彼此间差异更大的人了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. dated)(of an employee's wages) with board and lodging provided free

lj.lj_ly: your wages would be five shillings all found.
lj.lj_ls: 你们的工资是五先令，食宿免费。

lj.lj_ly: your wages would be five shillings all found.
lj.lj_ls: 你们的工资是五先令，食宿免费。

lj.lj_ly: the ballets did not &B{find favour with} the public.
lj.lj_ls: 芭蕾舞剧不受大众喜爱。

jx.jx_en_mean: stand up and become able to walk
experience a religious conversion or awakening

phrase.cizu_name: find it in one's heart to do something

jx.jx_en_mean: allow or force oneself to do something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 允许（或强迫）自己做，忍心做…

lj.lj_ly: Seb could not find it in his heart to dislike Plunkett.
lj.lj_ls: 塞布不忍心讨厌普朗凯特。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Law)(of a court) make a decision against or judge to be guilty

phrase.cizu_name: find for (或 find in favour of)

jx.jx_en_mean: (Law)(of a court) make a decision in favour of, or judge to be innocent

lj.lj_ly: the Court of Exchequer found for the plaintiffs.

jx.jx_en_mean: detect a person's immoral or offensive actions
jx.jx_cn_mean: 发觉，察觉，看出，看穿（某人的不道德或无礼行为）

lj.lj_ly: she would always find him out if he tried to lie.
lj.lj_ls: 要是他想撒谎，她总能察觉。

phrase.cizu_name: find something out (或 find out about something)

lj.lj_ly: he hadn't time to find out what was bothering her.
lj.lj_ls: 他无暇搞清是什么在困扰她。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 查明：如通过观察或询问查明（某事）

lj.lj_ly: I found out the phone number by looking it up. If you're not sure, find out.
lj.lj_ls: 通过查找我查到了电话号码。如果你不肯定，查一查

jx.jx_en_mean: To detect the true nature or character of; expose
jx.jx_cn_mean: 发现：探明真相或性质；暴露

lj.lj_ly: Most embezzlers are found out in the end.
lj.lj_ls: 大多数贪污犯最后都被查出并逮捕归案

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English findan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vinden and German finden

encyclopedia.content: find是linux 命令，它将档案系统内符合 expression 的档案列出来。你可以指要档案的名称、类别、时间、大小、权限等不同资讯的组合，只有完全相符的才会被列出来。find 根据下列规则判断 path 和 expression，在命令列上第一个 - ( ) , ! 之前的部分为 path，之后的是 expression。还有指DOS 命令 find，Excel 函数 find等。

entry.def: If you find someone or something, you see them or learn where they are.

example.ex: The police also found a pistol...
example.tran: 警方还发现了一把手枪。

example.ex: They have spent ages looking at the map and can't find a trace of anywhere called Darrowby...
example.tran: 他们对着地图细看了许久也没能找到那个叫达罗比的地方的影踪。

entry.def: If you find something that you need or want, you succeed in achieving or obtaining it.

example.ex: Many people here cannot find work...
example.tran: 这里很多人都找不到工作。

example.ex: So far they have not found a way to fight the virus...
example.tran: 迄今为止，他们还没有找到一种对抗该病毒的方法。

entry.def: If something is found in a particular place or thing, it exists in that place.

example.ex: Two thousand of France's 4,200 species of flowering plants are found in the park...
example.tran: 法国的 4,200 种开花植物中有 2,000种可见于这个公园。

example.ex: Fibre is found in cereal foods, beans, fruit and vegetables.
example.tran: 谷类食品、豆类、水果和蔬菜中含有纤维素。

entry.tran: 发现…处于某种状态;遇见;碰见
entry.def: If you find someone or something in a particular situation, they are in that situation when you see them or come into contact with them.

example.ex: They found her walking alone and depressed on the beach...
example.tran: 他们碰见她独自一人神色忧郁地走在海滩上。

example.ex: She returned to her east London home to find her back door forced open...
example.tran: 她回到在伦敦东区的住所时发现后门被撬开了。

entry.tran: (不知不觉中)发现(自己在做某事)
entry.def: If you find yourself doing something, you are doing it without deciding or intending to do it.

example.ex: It's not the first time that you've found yourself in this situation...
example.tran: 你陷入这种状况已经不是第一次了。

example.ex: I found myself having more fun than I had had in years...
example.tran: 我发现自己这些年来从未像现在这样开心过。

entry.tran: (某一时刻或事件)把…置于某种情形中
entry.def: If a time or event finds you in a particular situation, you are in that situation at the time mentioned or when the event occurs.

example.ex: Daybreak found us on a cold, clammy ship...
example.tran: 天亮时我们发现自己呆在一条冰冷黏湿的船上。

example.ex: His lunch did not take long to arrive and found him poring over a notepad covered with scrawls.
example.tran: 不久午餐就送来了，当时他正埋头于一本满是潦草字迹的记事簿。

entry.def: If you find that something is the case, you become aware of it or realize that it is the case.

example.ex: The two biologists found, to their surprise, that both groups of birds survived equally well...
example.tran: 这两位生物学家惊奇地发现，两组鸟都很好地存活了下来。

example.ex: At my age I would find it hard to get another job...
example.tran: 到了我这个年纪自己就会发觉很难再找到一份工作了。

entry.def: When a court or jury decides that a person on trial is guilty or innocent, you say that the person has been found guilty or not guilty.

example.ex: She was found guilty of manslaughter and put on probation for two years...
example.tran: 她被裁定过失杀人罪名成立，缓刑两年。

example.ex: When they found us guilty, I just went blank.
example.tran: 当他们判定我们有罪时，我的脑子顿时一片空白。

entry.def: You can use find to express your reaction to someone or something.

example.ex: I find most of the young men of my own age so boring...
example.tran: 我觉得和我同龄的年轻人大多都很无聊。

example.ex: We're sure you'll find it exciting!...
example.tran: 我们保证你一定会认为这很刺激的！

entry.tran: 感受到(愉快、安慰等情感)
entry.def: If you find a feeling such as pleasure or comfort in a particular thing or activity, you experience the feeling mentioned as a result of this thing or activity.

example.ex: How could anyone find pleasure in hunting and killing this beautiful creature?...
example.tran: 怎么会有人以猎杀这种美丽的动物为乐呢？

example.ex: I was too tired and frightened to find comfort in that familiar promise.
example.tran: 我既疲惫又恐惧，就连那熟悉的承诺都无法让我感到安慰。

entry.def: If you find the time or money to do something, you succeed in making or obtaining enough time or money to do it.

example.ex: I was just finding more time to write music...
example.tran: 我刚刚找到了更多时间来作曲。

example.ex: My sister helped me find the money for a private operation.
example.tran: 姐姐帮我筹集资金开办了一家私人企业。

entry.tran: (有价值的)发现;(有用的)发现物
entry.def: If you describe someone or something that has been discovered as a find, you mean that they are valuable, interesting, good, or useful.

example.ex: Another of his lucky finds was a pair of candle-holders...
example.tran: 他的另一个幸运发现是一对烛台。

example.ex: His discovery was hailed as the botanical find of the century.
example.tran: 他的发现被誉为本世纪植物学的最重大发现。

entry.tran: 找到正确的路(去某处);成功地到达
entry.def: If you find your way somewhere, you successfully get there by choosing the right way to go.

example.ex: He was an expert at finding his way, even in strange surroundings...
example.tran: 他是认路的行家，即使在陌生的环境中也是如此。

example.ex: After a while I pulled myself to my feet and found my way to the street.
example.tran: 过了一会儿我费力地站起身来，找到了那条大街。

entry.def: If something finds its way somewhere, it comes to that place, especially by chance.

example.ex: It is one of the very few Michelangelos that have found their way out of Italy...
example.tran: 这是少数几件流传到意大利境外的米开朗琪罗作品之一。

example.ex: The most unlikely objects found their way into his design and look absolutely right where he placed them.
example.tran: 那些最不可能的东西出现于他的设计中，并且在他的安排下显得恰得其所。

entry.tran: (尤指特意通过努力)发现，找出，查明
entry.def: If you find something out, you learn something that you did not already know, especially by making a deliberate effort to do so.

example.ex: It makes you want to watch the next episode to find out what's going to happen...
example.tran: 这让人想要看下一集，弄清紧接着会发生什么事。

example.ex: I was relieved to find out that my problems were due to a genuine disorder...
example.tran: 得知我的问题确实是由于病症引起的，我松了口气。

entry.tran: 查出…的不轨行为;揭发出
entry.def: If you find someone out, you discover that they have been doing something dishonest.

example.ex: Her face was so grave, I wondered for a moment if she'd found me out.
example.tran: 她的表情如此严肃，我一时怀疑她是不是已经知道了我干的事。

means.word_mean: 1. come upon, as if by accident; meet with;

sentences.sentence: "We find this idea in Plato"
"I happened upon the most wonderful bakery not very far from here"
"She chanced upon an interesting book in the bookstore the other day"

means.word_mean: 2. discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of;

sentences.sentence: "She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water"
"We found traces of lead in the paint"

means.word_mean: 3. come upon after searching; find the location of something that was missed or lost;

sentences.sentence: "Did you find your glasses?"
"I cannot find my gloves!"

means.word_mean: 4. after a calculation, investigation, experiment, survey, or study;

sentences.sentence: "find the product of two numbers"
"The physicist who found the elusive particle won the Nobel Prize"

means.word_mean: 5. come to believe on the basis of emotion, intuitions, or indefinite grounds;

sentences.sentence: "I feel that he doesn't like me"
"I find him to be obnoxious"
"I found the movie rather entertaining"
"We found Republicans winning the offices"
"You'll see a lot of cheating in this school"
"I want to see results"
"The 1960 saw the rebellion of the younger generation against established traditions"
"I want to see results"

means.word_mean: 7. get something or somebody for a specific purpose;

sentences.sentence: "I found this gadget that will serve as a bottle opener"
"I got hold of these tools to fix our plumbing"
"The chairman got hold of a secretary on Friday night to type the urgent letter"

means.word_mean: 8. make a discovery, make a new finding;

sentences.sentence: "Roentgen discovered X-rays"
"Physicists believe they found a new elementary particle"
"She found that he had lied to her"
"The story is false, so far as I can discover"
"She found the time and energy to take care of her aging parents"
"We found the money to send our sons to college"

means.word_mean: 11. decide on and make a declaration about;

sentences.sentence: "find someone guilty"
"These aspects of civilization do not find expression or receive an interpretation"
"His movie received a good review"
"I got nothing but trouble for my good intentions"

means.word_mean: 13. perceive oneself to be in a certain condition or place;

sentences.sentence: "I found myself in a difficult situation"
"When he woke up, he found himself in a hospital room"

means.word_mean: 14. get or find back; recover the use of;

sentences.sentence: "She regained control of herself"
"She found her voice and replied quickly"
"The arrrow found its mark"

means.word_mean: 16. accept and make use of one's personality, abilities, and situation;

sentences.sentence: "My son went to Berkeley to find himself"

auth_sentence.content: Find out more about our use of this data.
auth_sentence.res_content: Find out more about our use of this data.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Find out more about our use of this data.

auth_sentence.content: You can find a job that will satisfy you.
auth_sentence.res_content: You can find a job that will satisfy you.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You can find a job that will satisfy you.

auth_sentence.content: Traditionalists may find it all a bit too much.
auth_sentence.res_content: Traditionalists may find it all a bit too much.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Traditionalists may find it all a bit too much.

sentences.en: I have found the lost book.
sentences.cn: 我已经找到丢失的书了。

sentences.en: He found that the method worked.

sentences.cn: 请替玛丽找到她的提包。

sentences.en: She said she would find an electrician for us.
sentences.cn: 她说她要给我们找一个电工技师。

sentences.en: He couldn't find it in his heart abandoning her.

means.word_mean: 发觉, 感到, 认为

sentences.en: Did you find him what he wanted?
Mary tried several lines of work, but at last found herself as a teacher.
sentences.cn: 玛丽尝试了好几种工作, 最后她认为自己适合当教师。

sentences.en: We have found the farm (to) do well.
sentences.cn: 我们感觉到这个农场经营得好。

sentences.en: I found my headache coming on.
sentences.cn: 我觉得头开始疼起来了。

means.word_mean: 到达; 努力获得; （经寻找、研究或思考）发现, 查明, 找出, 求得

sentences.en: What do you find the total?

means.word_mean: 供给, 供应; 知道…是有的; 现有（可用）

sentences.en: I can't find that amount of money.
The jury found against the plaintiff.
sentences.cn: 陪审团做出不利于原告的判决。

sentences.en: That old book is quite a find.
sentences.cn: 那本古书是一个重大发现。

sentences.en: The new finds have deepened our knowledge of giant ape.
sentences.cn: 新的发现物加深了我们对巨猿的认识。

sentences.en: The jury found for the accused.
sentences.cn: 陪审团做出有利于被告的裁决。

jushi.english: I have found the lost book.
jushi.chinese: 我已经找到那丢失的书。

jushi.english: I can't find that amount of money.
Each student will find his own personal road to success.
jushi.chinese: 每个学生都将找到自己的成功之道。
